concept.title: Portal Window Elements
concept.shortdesc: The window comprises the following elements:

dd.p: In browser mode (as shown), the title bar shows the name of the workspace. In desktop mode, the title bar shows the name of the workspace, the name and port number of the Marvel Enterprise Portal Server, and the user name

dlentry.dd: Marvel Enterprise Portal has a menu bar that includes the four menus File, Edit, View and Help.

Your user ID requires Workspace Author Mode permission to create and maintain workspaces, including links. The toolbar has three tool groupings:
Toolbar menu Description
The message log view shows the status of events that have been opened on the entire monitored enterprise and can include up to 100 row entries at a time.
The notepad view is a simple text editor for writing notes about the workspace.
The table view shows a column for each attribute requested by the query and one or more rows of data. You can also get table views to show data samplings over a period of time.

dd.p: The Navigator provides a physical view of your monitored network, organized by operating system platform, system type, Marvel Enterprise Monitoring product (agents), and the attribute groups from which the agents can collect information.

dlentry.dd: The workspace is the working area of the application window and consists of one or more views.
The status bar has several sections showing the Hub Time, Server Available, and Workspace name. You can turn off the display of the status bar through the View menu.
The status bar has several sections showing the Hub Time, Server Available, and Workspace name. You can turn off the display of the status bar through the View menu.
